thread.title: ONTARIO: Contestants set to pull plane for charity
thread.title_full: ONTARIO: Contestants set to pull plane for charity - Press Enterprise

author: The Press-Enterprise
title: ONTARIO: Contestants set to pull plane for charity
text:
STAFF REPORT
 11:51 a.m. ONTARIO: Contestants set to pull plane for charity 1 of 3 More Teams competed in last year’s Pull For Our Heroes plane pull competition benefiting the USO. This year’s event is Saturday, Oct. 24, at Ontario International Airport. , PAUL ALVAREZ, FILE PHOTO Related article » Ever tried to pull a 727 plane 25 feet?
Contestants in the seventh annual Pull for Our Heroes plane pull competition will be doing just that Saturday, Oct. 24.
The event will benefit Bob Hope USO Ontario and is set for 9:30 a.m. to noon at Ontario International Airport.
The event also will raise money for other non-profit groups, including Travelers Aid of the Inland Empire, Baldy View ROP Foundation and the airport’s educational outreach programs for disadvantaged students.
The contest will pit 20-member teams of men and women against a 120,000 lb. 727 aircraft. Each team will have two chances to pull the plane 25 feet. The event also will feature exhibitor booths, military vehicles and music from the Ontario High School Jazz Band.
Festivities will be at the airport’s Terminal 1 Tarmac, 1940 E. Moore Way. Free parking is in Lot F.
Information: flyontario.com
�• �• �•
Here are some other things going on this weekend:
SATURDAY, OCT. 24 �• History, horticulture, and planting are the themes of a family program set for Saturday, Oct. 24, at the John Rains House.
The event is set for 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.The day’s activities are included with general admission.
Children can plant their own jade tree. April Garbat of Rancho Santa Ana Botanic Gardens will speak on Using Native Plants in Your Garden. Water-wise Gardening in Time of Drought will be addressed by Erin Morales of the Cucamonga Valley Water District. Tours of the historic house also will be offerred.
The house is at 8810 Hemlock St., Rancho Cucamonga. General admission is $5 for adults, $4 for military and seniors, and $2.50 for students and children ages 5 to 12. Children under 5 and Museum Association members are free.
Information: sbcountymuseum.org
�• Songs of Hope, an annual musical tribute to those who are or have been touched by breast cancer, is set for Saturday, Oct. 24, at The Grove Theatre.
